Class WorkerPool

java.lang.Object
net.greghaines.jesque.worker.WorkerPool
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, JobExecutor, Worker
public class WorkerPool extends Object implements Worker
WorkerPool creates a fixed number of identical Workers, each on a separate Thread.

      Create a WorkerPool with the given number of Workers and the default ThreadFactory.
      Parameters:
      workerFactory - a Callable that returns an implementation of Worker
      numWorkers - the number of Workers to create

    • WorkerPool

      public WorkerPool(Callable<? extends Worker> workerFactory, int numWorkers, ThreadFactory threadFactory)
      Create a WorkerPool with the given number of Workers and the given ThreadFactory.
      Parameters:
      workerFactory - a Callable that returns an implementation of Worker
      numWorkers - the number of Workers to create
      threadFactory - the factory to create pre-configured Threads

  • Method Details

    • endAndJoin

      public void endAndJoin(boolean now, long millis) throws InterruptedException
      Shutdown this pool and wait millis time per thread or until all threads are finished if millis is 0.
      Parameters:
      now - if true, an effort will be made to stop any jobs in progress
      millis - the time to wait in milliseconds for the threads to join; a timeout of 0 means to wait forever.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if any thread has interrupted the current thread. The interrupted status of the current thread is cleared when this exception is thrown.

    • getWorkerCount

      public int getWorkerCount()
      Returns:
      the number of total workers

    • getActiveWorkerCount

      public int getActiveWorkerCount()
      Returns:
      the number of workers processing jobs

    • getIdleWorkerCount

      public int getIdleWorkerCount()
      Returns:
      the number of workers not processing jobs

    • join

      public void join(long millis) throws InterruptedException
      Join to internal threads and wait millis time per thread or until all threads are finished if millis is 0.
      Specified by:
      join in interface JobExecutor
      Parameters:
      millis - the time to wait in milliseconds for the threads to join; a timeout of 0 means to wait forever.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if any thread has interrupted the current thread. The interrupted status of the current thread is cleared when this exception is thrown.

      Specified by:
      isPaused in interface Worker
      Returns:

      Parameters:

    • addQueue

      public void addQueue(String queueName)
      Poll the given queue. If the queue exists multiple times, it will be checked that many times per loop. This allows for a queue to be given higher priority by checking it more often.
      Specified by:
      addQueue in interface Worker
      Parameters:
      queueName - the name of the queue to poll

    • removeQueue

      public void removeQueue(String queueName, boolean all)
      Stop polling the given queue. If the all argument is true, all instances of the queue will be removed, otherwise, only one instance is removed.
      Specified by:
      removeQueue in interface Worker
      Parameters:
      queueName - the queue to stop polling
      all - whether to remove all or only one of the instances

    • removeAllQueues
